description.narrative: Sida avser att ge kärnstöd till Transparency International Georgia (TI) under perioden september 2015 - december 2017, med totalt 12,5 MSEK varav 500 000 SEK avsätts för att finansiera en utvärdering under 2017. TIs arbete syftar till att öka transparens och möjligheter till ansvarutkrävande inom statliga myndigheter och institutioner på lokal och nationell nivå i Georgien. TI arbetar med påverkansarbete, analys, bevakning och rapportering samt med kapacitetsutveckling. TI arbetar i nära samarbete med såväl statliga aktörer som med civilsamhället.

Transparency International Georgia core support 2015 - 2017. TI works in the area of anti-corruption and good governance with the aim to increase transparency and accountability in national and local government in Georgia. TI works through advocacy, monitoring and capacity building in close cooperation with both state actors and civil society.
The overall objective of Transparency International Georgia's work is to ensure that national and local governments operate in a transparent and accountable manner.

description.narrative: Georgia has made considerable progress in reducing and even eliminating certain types of corruption (e.g. bribery in public services) over the last decade and a half. At the same time, the country is yet to develop appropriate mechanisms for dealing effectively with more complex forms of corruption (including those involving high-level officials and influential politicians). This is why Transparency International Georgia has continued, during the project period, collecting information about the suspicious cases and delivering this information to the public. TI Georgia has been also actively involved in the public discussions of constitutional reforms and presenting proposals concerning changes in the electoral system, independence of the judiciary, and improvement of parliamentary oversight. Working on political corruption cases was another important aspect of TI Georgia’s work. TI Georgia tried to show how the ruling political party and certain business groups were interconnected. TI Georgia published three comprehensive reports on political party donors and their interests in public procurement or other state benefits. Numerous cases were highlighted when concrete companies and their owners donated large amounts of money to the ruling party and in exchange they got significant benefits from the state. Another aspect of political corruption was related with those public officials who have donated to the ruling party more money than their officially declared income. More than ten such cases were described in the report that was published in March 2017. The research finding attracted huge public and media interest. TI Georgia continuously has monitored the judicial system, closely following the developments directly or indirectly related to the judiciary. Number of very alarming trends were identified and publicly reported in 2017. Informal governance in the system and influences of particular judges over their peers has increased. The government and the parliament unfortunately were reluctant to carry effective reform and moreover by their inactivity they have actually contributed to the gradual strengthening of the informal governance practice at the judiciary. This has had extremely negative consequences within the system, such as strengthening cronyism and silencing dissenting opinions. A new alarming information started to appear in 2017. Different business association and individuals started to report on the problems in judiciary related to the ungrounded and unfair decisions and procedure. The allegations of corruption have significantly increased in 2017. TI Georgia started to review and evaluate cases that are reported by different international and local companies and private individuals. At this moment TI Georgia is studying several cases, where there is legitimate ground to suspect corruption. Another result of the contribution is that TI Georgia has improved its organisational capacity as it developed and implements set of internal guidelines and regulations. This result enhances TI Georgia chances to attract more donors for working towards its objectives. One of the examples is that TI Georgia managed to sign an Agreement with Norwegian MFA and supports TI Georgia as a donor.
